title: Brexit crunch week: What will happen in Westminster and Europe?
text:
It is Brexit crunch week. In Brussels and in Westminster, officials are working around the clock to find a pathway to a deal. But a deal is not the end of the road - it has to pass through Parliament and the clock is ticking ahead of Oct 31.

With so many possible twists and turns, here's how the week will play out.

Monday Oct 14

Queen's Speech: Parliament reconvened, which set the stage for further attempts by lawmakers to ensure the Oct 31 deadline for withdrawal is extended, regardless of Boris Johnson’s promise that the UK will leave on that date, deal or no deal. In Parliament, the Queen delivered the Prime Minister’s legislative agenda. The package of 22 bills was heavy on law and order, with legislation designed to keep serious criminals in prison for longer, impose tougher sentences on foreign offenders who return to the UK and provide better protection for victims of domestic abuse.
